text: The 2001 Australian Individual Speedway Championship was held at the Riverview Speedway in Murray Bridge, South Australia on 3 February. Former World #3 Todd Wiltshire won his second Australian Championship after defeating defending champion Leigh Adams in a runoff.2001 World Speedway results Mick Poole from New South Wales finished third after defeating Perth's Steve Johnston in a runoff, while Shane Parker defeated fellow Adelaide riders Brett Woodifield and Nigel Sadler in a runoff to claim the final spot in the Overseas Final. ==2001 Australian Solo Championship== * 3 February 2001 * Murray Bridge - Riverview Speedway * Referee: * Qualification: The top five riders go through to the Overseas Final in Poole, England. {| class=wikitable !width=25px|Pos. ||width=200px|Rider ||width=40px|Points ||width=70px|Details |-align=center |Gold ||align=left| Todd Wiltshire () ||14+3 || |-align=center |Silver ||align=left| Leigh Adams () ||14+2 || |-align=center |Bronze ||align=left| Mick Poole () ||10+3 || |-align=center |4 ||align=left| Steve Johnston () ||10+2 || |-align=center |5 ||align=left| Shane Parker () ||9+3 || |-align=center |6 ||align=left| Brett Woodifield () ||9+2 || |-align=center |7 ||align=left| Nigel Sadler () ||9+1 || |-align=center |8 ||align=left| Craig Watson () ||8 || |-align=center |9 ||align=left| Jason Lyons () ||7 || |-align=center |10 ||align=left| Travis McGowan () ||6 || |-align=center |11 ||align=left| Adam Shields () ||5 || |-align=center |12 ||align=left| Lee Redmond () ||4 || |-align=center |13 ||align=left| Rusty Harrison () ||4 || |-align=center |14 ||align=left| Davey Watt () ||2 || |-align=center |15 ||align=left| Dean Wiseman () ||2 || |-align=center |16 ||align=left| Christian Henry () ||1 || |} ==References== ==See also== * Australia national speedway team * Sport in Australia Category:Speedway in Australia Australia Individual Speedway Championship Category:February 2001 sports events in Oceania
